7. one event at pentor sports day is throwing a tennis ball.  the distance a child throws a 
tennis ball is modelled by a normal distribution with mean 32 m and standard deviation  
12 m.  any child who throws the tennis ball more than 50 m is awarded a gold certificate.
 
(a) show that, to 3 significant figures, 6.68% of children are awarded a gold certificate.
(3)
 
a silver certificate is awarded to any child who throws the tennis ball more than d  metres 
but less than 50 m.
 
given that 19.1% of the children are awarded a silver certificate,
 
(b) find the value of d.
(4)
 
three children are selected at random from those who take part in the throwing a tennis 
ball event.
 
(c) find the probability that 1 is awarded a gold certificate and 2 are awarded silver 
certificates.  give your answer to 2 significant figures.
(3)
